It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Legal Indictment] 1789 Feb. [to] Washington District Superior Court / State of N [orth] Carolina
bibl.author: State of North Carolina
bibl.note: This document is a legal indictment by the state of North Carolina against Ezekial Abell, dated February Term 1789. The indictment states that the grand jury of the state indicted Abell for stealing 600 feet of planks from a man named Jacob Nidevor.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

address.addrLine:
Washington District Superior Court
Feby February Sessions 1789

div.p: The Grand jurors for the state upon their Oath present and say that Ezekial Abell blacksmith late of thecounty of Washington Blacksmith did on the twenty third day of October last past ‚ÅÅ in the County aforesaid with force and Arms enter on the premises of Jacob Nidevor and he the said Ezekial Abell did then and there forcibly take and carry away of the property of the said Jacob Nidevor six hundred and sixty feet of plank to the damage of the said Jacob and to the evil example of all others in like cases offending and against the peace and dignity of the state

closer.signed:
Wm. William Cocke
Atto. Attorney for State
